meanings.definition: The act or process of forming cloth by interlacing threads
meanings.sent1: I watched the weaving of a beautiful rug at the market.
meanings.sent2: The weaving of the fabric was intricate and detailed.
meanings.sent3: The weaving of the spider's web was a masterpiece of nature.
meanings.sent4: The weaving of colors in the tapestry created a stunning visual effect.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of the weaving loom filled the room with a sense of calm.

meanings.definition: To form by combining various elements or details into a connected whole
meanings.sent1: She was weaving a story that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The author was weaving together different plotlines in the novel.
meanings.sent3: The chef was weaving flavors together to create a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: The artist was weaving emotions into every brushstroke of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The dancer was weaving movements seamlessly to express her emotions.
